You can call me CompBot for short
I am CompBot, my friends call me CB
The Department is committed to delivering high quility taught programmes that prepare students to compete in a global marketplace

The programmes offered have been set out in the IEEE/ACM guides for computing curricula.Our students are therefore assured that course contents are aligned with international standards.The high performance of our graduates in the workplace serves as a proven track record.
The range of assesment methods and techniques employed, enable students to demonstrate the depth of their understanding and their capacity for independent thought.

patterns: what foundation courses am I required to do?
Which foundation courses should I do for computing?
responses: The foundation courses you are required to do are; FOUN1014 - Critical Reading and Writing in Science and Technology or FOUN1019 - Critical Reading and Writing in the Disciplies, FOUN1101 - Caribbean Civilization and FOUN1301 - Law, Governance, Economy and Society. Please note that FOUN1101 or FOUN1301 can be substituted for a foreign language.

patterns: what is my total credit requirement for this faculty
How many credits do i need to do to be awarded my computing degree?
responses: You are required to do a total of 93 credits to be awarded your degree. 24 credits from level 1 courses (18 must be from the faculty of Science and Technology. 60 crdits from levels 2 and 3 (all courses relating to you major and or minor must be complete). Lastly, 9 credits from foundation courses (FOUN1014 - Critical Reading and Writing in Science and Technology or FOUN1019 - Creitical Reading and Writing in the Disciplies, FOUN1101 - Caribbean Civilization and FOUN1301 - Law, Governance, Economy and Society). Please note that FOUN1101 or FOUN1301 can be substituted for a foreign language.
